I have opened this thread at least 6 times today to laugh at that meme lol
Sad but true
I don't watch LCS so I don't know how accurate this is as commentary, but good job on this hilarious new meme.
ty ty lol :P
I felt uncomfortable about the amount of times the casters began roasting Meteos.

Normally don't watch LCS, Worlds (whatever you kids are calling it these days.) But I saw that match, and thought it was the poster child for how comps determine games. Was pretty sad. I mean, seriously, even when C9 was heavily behind the whole game, it was still their game to lose. FW makes 20 good plays in a row and can't close it out. Then C9 FINALLY makes a couple decent plays and wins. Commentators kept whining about FW being too timid. But what were they suppose to do? I saw what FW was avoiding. If they made ONE wrong move against that other comp, they'd be toast. And they didn't make one wrong move... for like an hour. Then they screwed up once and were goners.

Then C9 FINALLY makes a couple decent plays and wins. Commentators kept whining about FW being too timid. But what were they suppose to do? I saw what FW was avoiding. If they made ONE wrong move against that other comp, they'd be toast. And they didn't make one wrong move... for like an hour. Then they screwed up once and were goners.

but it was the same for C9...one wrong move and it is gg Meteos made the right move and they won the game
Except C9 did keep making mistakes. That's why FW got ahead in the first place.

they drafted a heavy poke comp.

it seems to not be working out, no one can get in and do anything about the massive damage varus puts out.
